DataElement.preferredName: Dental Pulp Exposure Permanent Tooth Yes or No Response
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions. Contact with infectious agents (bacteria or viruses) in a manner that promotes transmission and increases the likelihood of disease. Any of the 32 teeth that replace the deciduous teeth of early childhood. A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions. Contact with infectious agents (bacteria or viruses) in a manner that promotes transmission and increases the likelihood of disease. Any of the 32 teeth that replace the deciduous teeth of early childhood.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. (CDC)

Concepts.definition: A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions.
The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience.
